document_data.name: Lo'S'sem Gompa
document_data.mainbody: '''Lo'S'sem Gompa''' was a [[monastery]] (a gompa in the [[Tabotan language]]) of the [[Way of Enlightenment]] in [[Tabot]].
document_data.Geography: It was found in the south of Tabot.
document_data.Description: [[Pang]] of [[Pokarr Gompa]] dismissed Lo'S'sem, [[Jo'nai Gompa|Jo'nai]], and [[Mafensea Gompa]]s as "all alike", with "primitive and gaudy" ceremonies.
document_data.History:
It was founded some time between {{YearlinkConvert|585|SY}} and {{YearlinkConvert|640|SY}}, when fifteen groups of monks and temple guardians escaped persecution in [[Shou Lung]] and journeyed southwest in search of a holy land that would remain pure and lasting, ideal for isolated hermitages. One of these groups built the beginnings of Lo'S'sem.

''Circa'' {{YearlinkConvert|2607|SY}}, Lo'S'sem was among those southern monasteries opposing the northern monasteries in the yig-tsang (monk council) of Tabot.
